result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica M Bruckner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.
Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

No Contact with the Store listed in the criminal complaint on case 16CM1895. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Cases 15CM1753 and 15CM910 were dismissed and read in. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 145 days were granted. Balance of 5 days to be served.  No Good Time. Commencing forthwith.
Concurrent with: Case 16CM1895 and 17CT303
Costs previously imposed have been paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Monica M Bruckner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to pay for such appointed counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 6/1/15 until paid in full.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
